sentences.en: Crisp and toned, the TSX doesn't deviate heavily from its predecessor.
sentences.cn: 清晰,柔和,在TSX并不严重偏离其前任.

sentences.en: During the transience the electron and photon populations deviate slightly from their equilibrium values respectively.
sentences.cn: 在瞬态过程中,电子和光子的密度各稍微偏离其平衡值.

sentences.en: He planned his schedule far in advance, and he didn't deviate from it.
sentences.cn: 他提前很早就制订出了自己的进度表，然后从未偏离过它。

sentences.en: His statement seemed slightly to deviate from the truth.
sentences.cn: 他的话似乎有些不符合事实.

sentences.en: I will never deviate from what I believe to be right.
sentences.cn: 我绝不背离我自信正确的道路.

sentences.en: Never deviate from holding that note.
sentences.cn: 保持那个音符,千万不要偏离.

sentences.en: Pull you back if you deviate of the direction.
sentences.cn: 当你偏离方向,把你拉回来.

sentences.en: The bus had to deviate from its usual route because of a road closure.
sentences.cn: 因为道路封闭，公共汽车只得绕道而行。

sentences.en: The plane had to deviate from its normal flight path.
sentences.cn: 那架飞机只好偏离正常的航线.

sentences.en: The stress - strain curve soon deviate from the elastic line.
sentences.cn: 应力 -- 应变曲线将立即偏离弹性线.

sentences.en: The teacher deviate from her custom and gave out no homework.
sentences.cn: 这位老师与以往不同,不布置家庭作业.

sentences.en: There's a formula and very rarely do I deviate from that.
sentences.cn: 这是我的原则,我极少违背这个原则.

sentences.en: They stopped you as soon as you deviated from the script.
sentences.cn: 你一偏离剧本，他们就会叫停。

trans.tran_en: to change what you are doing so that you are not following an expected plan, idea, or type of behaviour
to change what you are doing so that you are not following an expected plan, idea, or type of behaviour
